# Cloud Computing using AWS
According to [1], Amazon Web Services is a subsidiary of Amazon providing on-demand cloud computing platforms and APIs to individuals, companies, and governments, on a metered pay-as-you-go basis. Amazon Web Services offers reliable, scalable, and inexpensive cloud computing services.

In this project, we aim to use AWS to develop two computing systems within a web application: 

1- CloudCal and 2- CloudPic

## CloudCal
CloudCal is an AWS application in which a client submits a request, which is composed of a list of numerical values, to a worker on EC2 [2].  The EC2 worker is a Python application that receives the request and calculates the min, max, average, median and send them back to the client. Morever, EC2 Worker stores the calculate values as a log file on S3 Amazon Storage Cloud [3].
### Architecture and Sequence Diagram
#### Client
is a python code hosted on local machines and is resposible to creates an SQS Queue [4] for requests (called the requestQueue) on order to submit a request containing a list of 20 integers to cloud and receives the response from the EC2 worker.

#### EC2 Worker
is a python code hosted on cloud and runs on an EC2 instance in order to reads the messages from the requestQueue, Calculates the outputs, creates a response queue (called responseQueue) and submits the result, and finally, Create a new log file (a text file) and store it on Amazon S3.
[![](https://mermaid.ink/img/eyJjb2RlIjoic2VxdWVuY2VEaWFncmFtXG4gICAgQ2xpZW50LT4--PisgUzM6IENyZWF0ZSBhIG5ldyBsb2cgZmlsZVxuICAgIEVDMiBXb3JrZXIgLT4-KyBTUVM6IENyZWF0ZXMgYW4gU1FTIFF1ZXVlIGZvciBSZXNwb25kXG4gICAgU1FTICAtPj4rICBXZWIgQXBwbGljYXRpb24gOiBSZWFkIHRoZSBtZXNzYWdlcyBmcm9tIHRoZSByZXNwb25kUXVldWVcbiAgICBXZWIgQXBwbGljYXRpb24gLT4-)](https://mermaid-js.github.io/mermaid-live-editor/#/edit/eyJjb2RlIjoic2VxdWVuY2VEaWFncmFtXG4gICAgQ2xpZW50LT4--PisgUzM6IENyZWF0ZSBhIG5ldyBsb2cgZmlsZVxuICAgIEVDMiBXb3JrZXIgLT4-KyBTUVM6IENyZWF0ZXMgYW4gU1FTIFF1ZXVlIGZvciBSZXNwb25kXG4gICAgU1FTICAtPj4rICBXZWIgQXBwbGljYXRpb24gOiBSZWFkIHRoZSBtZXNzYWdlcyBmcm9tIHRoZSByZXNwb25kUXVldWVcbiAgICBXZWIgQXBwbGljYXRpb24gLT4-)

## CloudPic
CloudPic is an AWS application that enhances the quality of a picture up to 30% in which a user uploads an image to the cloud through a bucket in S3 [3], places the key to this uploaded image in the inbox, and queues to EC2 Worker and waits for this message to be processed. EC2 worker wait for messages to appear in the inbox queue, and then it retrieves the referenced image file from S3, enhance the quality of the image, place the resulting image in S3, place the key to the result image file in the outbox queue, and delete the message from the inbox queue.

### Architecture and Sequence Diagram
#### Client
is a python code hosted on local machines and is resposible to upload an image into the cloud through a bucket in S3 and creates an SQS Queue for requests (called the requestQueue) and receives the response from the EC2 worker.

#### EC2 Worker
is a python code hosted on cloud and runs on an EC2 instance in order to reads the messages from the requestQueue, download the image from S3 bucket, enhance the pricture, upload the processed image in the bucket S3, creates a response queue (called responseQueue) to the Client.
[![](https://mermaid.ink/img/eyJjb2RlIjoic2VxdWVuY2VEaWFncmFtXG4gICAgQ2xpZW50LT4-KyBXZWIgQXBwbGljYXRpb246IEluc2VydGluZyB0aGUgcGljdHVyZVxuICAgIFdlYiBBcHBsaWNhdGlvbiAtPj4rIFMzOiBVcGxvYWQgdGhlIHBpY3R1cmUgb24gQnVja2V0IFMzXG4gICAgV2ViIEFwcGxpY2F0aW9uIC0-PisgU1FTOiBDcmVhdGVzIGFuIFNRUyBRdWV1ZSBmb3IgcmVxdWVzdHNcbiAgICBTUVMgLT4-KyBFQzIgV29ya2VyOiBSZWFkcyB0aGUgbWVzc2FnZXMgZnJvbSB0aGUgcmVxdWVzdFF1ZXVlXG4gICAgUzMgLT4-KyBFQzIgV29ya2VyOiBEb3dubG9hZCB0aGUgaW1hZ2VcbiAgICBFQzIgV29ya2VyIC0-PisgRUMyIFdvcmtlcjogSW1hZ2UgUHJvY2Nlc3NpbmdcbiAgICBFQzIgV29ya2VyIC0-PisgUzM6IFVwbG9hZCB0aGUgcHJvY2Vzc2VkIGltYWdlXG4gICAgRUMyIFdvcmtlciAtPj4rIFNRUzogQ3JlYXRlcyBhbiBTUVMgUXVldWUgZm9yIFJlc3BvbmRcbiAgICBTUVMgIC0-PisgIFdlYiBBcHBsaWNhdGlvbiA6IFJlYWQgdGhlIG1lc3NhZ2VzIGZyb20gdGhlIHJlc3BvbmRRdWV1ZVxuICAgUzMgLT4-KyBXZWIgQXBwbGljYXRpb246IERvd25sb2FkIHRoZSBwaWN0dXJlIGZyb20gUzMgQnVja2V0XG4gICAgV2ViIEFwcGxpY2F0aW9uIC0-)](https://mermaid-js.github.io/mermaid-live-editor/#/edit/eyJjb2RlIjoic2VxdWVuY2VEaWFncmFtXG4gICAgQ2xpZW50LT4-KyBXZWIgQXBwbGljYXRpb246IEluc2VydGluZyB0aGUgcGljdHVyZVxuICAgIFdlYiBBcHBsaWNhdGlvbiAtPj4rIFMzOiBVcGxvYWQgdGhlIHBpY3R1cmUgb24gQnVja2V0IFMzXG4gICAgV2ViIEFwcGxpY2F0aW9uIC0-PisgU1FTOiBDcmVhdGVzIGFuIFNRUyBRdWV1ZSBmb3IgcmVxdWVzdHNcbiAgICBTUVMgLT4-KyBFQzIgV29ya2VyOiBSZWFkcyB0aGUgbWVzc2FnZXMgZnJvbSB0aGUgcmVxdWVzdFF1ZXVlXG4gICAgUzMgLT4-KyBFQzIgV29ya2VyOiBEb3dubG9hZCB0aGUgaW1hZ2VcbiAgICBFQzIgV29ya2VyIC0-PisgRUMyIFdvcmtlcjogSW1hZ2UgUHJvY2Nlc3NpbmdcbiAgICBFQzIgV29ya2VyIC0-PisgUzM6IFVwbG9hZCB0aGUgcHJvY2Vzc2VkIGltYWdlXG4gICAgRUMyIFdvcmtlciAtPj4rIFNRUzogQ3JlYXRlcyBhbiBTUVMgUXVldWUgZm9yIFJlc3BvbmRcbiAgICBTUVMgIC0-PisgIFdlYiBBcHBsaWNhdGlvbiA6IFJlYWQgdGhlIG1lc3NhZ2VzIGZyb20gdGhlIHJlc3BvbmRRdWV1ZVxuICAgUzMgLT4-KyBXZWIgQXBwbGljYXRpb246IERvd25sb2FkIHRoZSBwaWN0dXJlIGZyb20gUzMgQnVja2V0XG4gICAgV2ViIEFwcGxpY2F0aW9uIC0-)

# How to Run and Test 

For the Client side, we just need to "run app.py" that is our web application located in web-app branch. Everything is well described in the web application and client need to do nothing but to input data for CloudCal and a picture for CloudPic. On the server side, we need to run "EC2Worker.py" and "Server_Image.py" on EC2 Instances respectively that are located in the server branch.
